body_html: Given that we are adding ellipses (which breaks Python parseability), I don't think slavishly following the "it must be a valid Python expression" makes sense. For example, we can add the shape as a comment as a newline at the very end of the expression. This is not strictly following the Python guidelines, but it follows the spirit and solves the problem.

body: Given that we are adding ellipses (which breaks Python parseability), I don't think slavishly following the "it must be a valid Python expression" makes sense. For example, we can add the shape as a comment as a newline at the very end of the expression. This is not strictly following the Python guidelines, but it follows the spirit and solves the problem.
